chapters.summary: Steve McLellan, Randy Hodgens and Paul Chadwick. Rick Green, Dan Redican and Peter Wildman are the creators of the comedy group boot to the Frantics. The group formed in Toronto in 1979 and gained a following with offthewall humor in the vein of Monty Python and the Goons. By 1981, the franchise had secured their own CBC radio comedy program called Frantic Times. They tried to make the move to the small screen, but the series four on the floor lasted just 13 weeks and the group began a long hiatus in 1989. In 2004, fans clamored for a reunion and in 2004 the Frantic began issuing new recordings.
chapters.headline: Steve McLellan, Randy Hodgens and Paul Chadwick. Rick Green, dan Redican and Peter Wildman are the creators of the comedy group boot to the Frantics.

podcast_title: Laugh Tracks Legends of Comedy with Randy and Steve
